solution.text:
1 km = 100000 cm
Actual height= 8800km = 8800 x 100000 cm
Height on map = 4.4 cm
Scale= Height on map/Actual height = \(4.4/(8800 \times 10^5)\) = \( 5: 10^9\)

content.text: The actual height of Mount Everest is 8800 km, and its height is 4.4 cm represented on a map. What is the scale used for the map?
